perturbation.original_text:
License Term
Perpetual, unlimited runs
x Other: 2 years
Commencing: November 15, 2012
perturbation.changed_text:
License Term
Perpetual, unlimited runs
x Other: 2 years
x Other: 5 years
Commencing: November 15, 2012
perturbation.explanation: This creates an in-text contradiction by introducing two different license terms. It is unclear which of the conflicting terms (2 years or 5 years) governs the agreement, leading to potential disputes.

perturbation.original_text:
3.
Consideration. The Producer agrees and acknowledges that it will receive no upfront compensation for the rights it has granted herein and
that ConvergTV has no obligation to Producer to exercise any of its rights under this Agreement. The revenue share for the Program is stated
in Exhibit B. The Producer shall have thirty (30) days from the payment date to dispute the amount of any revenue share payout or any such
claim or dispute is hereby waived by the Producer.
perturbation.changed_text:
3.
Consideration. The Producer agrees and acknowledges that it will receive no upfront compensation for the rights it has granted herein and
that ConvergTV has no obligation to Producer to exercise any of its rights under this Agreement. The revenue share for the Program is stated
in Exhibit B. The Producer shall have sixty (60) days from the payment date to dispute the amount of any revenue share payout or any such
claim or dispute is hereby waived by the Producer.
perturbation.explanation: This creates an in-text contradiction by changing the period to dispute any revenue share payout from 30 days to 60 days. This will lead to uncertainty about what the actual dispute period is and potential disputes when the producer tries to claim after 30 days.

perturbation.original_text:
14..
Notices. All notices, statements or requests for approvals ("Notices") that either Party hereto is required or may desire to give to the other
shall be given in writing by addressing the same to the other at the addresses set forth herein, or at such other address as may be designated,
in writing, by any such Party in a Notice to the other. Notices shall be made by personal delivery, overnight courier, first class registered mail
(postage prepaid and return receipt requested), facsimile or e-mail. A Notice shall be deemed served and received on the date executed on a
receipt of acceptance or if by personal delivery, upon physical delivery of the same.
perturbation.changed_text:
14..
Notices. All notices, statements or requests for approvals ("Notices") that either Party hereto is required or may desire to give to the other
shall be given in writing by addressing the same to the other at the addresses set forth herein, or at such other address as may be designated,
in writing, by any such Party in a Notice to the other. Notices shall be made by personal delivery, overnight courier, first class registered mail
(postage prepaid and return receipt requested), facsimile or e-mail. A Notice shall be deemed served and received five (5) days after the date of mailing or transmission, except for personal delivery, which shall be deemed served upon physical delivery of the same.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces an in-text contradiction. The original clause states that a notice is received on the date executed on a receipt of acceptance, but the modification introduces a 5-day delay for mailed/transmitted notices. This creates uncertainty about when a notice is officially considered 'received'.
